text: John Cobley (1872-1958), was an Australian lawn bowls international who competed in the 1950 British Empire Games. ==Bowls career== At the 1950 British Empire Games he won the silver medal in the fours event with his brother James Cobley, Len Knight and Charles Cordaiy. He was the 1949 Australian National Bowls Championships rinks (fours) winner, bowling with the same trio and for the Parkes Bowls Club in New South Wales. ==References== Category:Australian male bowls players Category:1872 births Category:1958 deaths Category:Bowls players at the 1950 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games silver medallists for Australia Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in lawn bowls
title: John Cobley
